title: [Epic] StatusQ: Qt Proxy Models Library

milestone.description:
## Messaging & Communities team 

**1. Continue to fix bugs and stabilise chat and communities functionality as top priority**
- includes any issues found during dogfooding

**2. Status Communities / Discord bridge**
- Ensure bridge works with token gated communities (e.g. permission is set at the community level that requires a token to be held to be a member of that community)
- Ensure bridge works with token gated channels
- On the Status Desktop side, individual messages from Discord are displayed as individual messages with Discord usernames

**3. Ability to mark a token gated channel as 'hidden'**
- A token gated channel that's marked as 'hidden' is only visible to community members that have the requisite tokens to access this channel
- Design for this is completed

**4. Continue work on profile showcase**


 

## Wallet Team

**1. Fixing bugs, stabilisation of existing functionality**
- 0.17 will hopefully be our 2nd public beta release, so squashing bugs is the top priority

**2. Pre-tx signing dialog, for Community Admin, Browser, WalletConnet**
- Design still needs to be one on this item

**3. Continue work on WalletConnect support**

**4. Improved 'saved accounts' functionality and 'share address' dialogue**

**5. Database re-encryption flows**

**6. If the above is completed before the end of the cycle, start work on total balance graphs for 'All accounts' and each individual account and all graph functionality**

body:
# Qt Proxy Models Library

### Description

Over a year ago we introduced the SortFilterProxyModel library on the UI side. In many places it has greatly simplified both the backend and frontend. Although SFPM is a great tool, it does not address all needs. Sometimes there is a need to perform a different type of data transformation on the UI side.

Moreover proxy models has worth noting advantages:
- Hide complexity of potentially complicated actions in a well defined, extensively tested via unit tests, easy to use QML component.
- Are reusable - they doesn't address only single specific use-case. Are generic and can be reused in various context.
- They move responsibility of preparing data for display from the nim backend to UI layer. Thanks to that nim-layer can be more business-logic oriented  and simpler. And also easier to port to C++ in the future.
- Proxy models are written in C++, can be used without any changes in the upcoming C++/Qt6 version of the app.

For that reason 3 initial proxy models has been introduced:

- [x] `LeftJoinModel`, `RenamingProxyModel` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12502, https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12574
It allows joining two models similarly as two tables can be joined in SQL using Left Join operation. Established join is fully dynamic - all changes in source models are reflected in the output model.

- [x] `SubmodelProxyModel` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12630
It allows to apply transformations also to submodels, directly from the level of top-level model.

Those utilities has been adopted in real use cases and identified as useful building blocks. Moreover other proxies has been identified as useful and could help simplifying code or improving performance in our codebase:

- [x] `ConcatModel` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12682
Proxy allowing to concatenate multiple models in order to render them using single `ListView`. It has been identified to have big potential to improve performance bc it may prevent lists "unrolling" and instantiating all delegates up-front. Initial discussion can be found here: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/12469. Another interesting approach to solve mentioned performance problem is investigated here: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12666

- [ ] `GroupByModel` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12683
Proxy allowing grouping rows according to provided criteria. Grouped items are exposed by additional role holding submodel.

- [x] `AggregateModel` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/13230
Proxy allowing to compute single value from a submodel. E.g. when top-level model contains rows representing tokens by token symbol and has role holding submodel storing balances per chain, it's useful to have a sum of all per-chain balances as a top-level role. This proxy is intended to provide possibility of adding such roles based on submodels in an effective and dynamic way.

- [ ] `MovableModel` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12686
Proxy decorating source mode with additional method `move(from, to)` similar to that available in `ListModel`. The custom order is stored within a proxy, not altering the original model. May be useful whenever UI needs to allow user to set custom order. Temporary state can be held in the proxy, and send to the backend when changes are accepted.

- [x] `WritableModel` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12690
Proxy decorating source mode with additional method(s) allowing to overwrite value of any property from the model. The temporary (dirty) state would be kept by the proxy, leaving source model unmodified.

`SortFilterProxyModel` improvements/extensions:
- [x] `FastExpressionRole` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/13047
- [x] `FastExpressionSorter` https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/13062
- [x] `FastExpressionFilter` https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/13063

Related utilities:
- [x] `Aggregator` - https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12685
Utility for computing aggregated value from a model.

Other adjustmesnts:
- https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/13065
